channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Elon Musk, the world's richest man, struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion. What will the purchase mean for the social network? Join @sheeraf, @LaurenSHirsch and @kateconger at 8 p.m. ET to discuss the implications. DM questions to @nytimesevents. https://t.co/0DJOq3uTAf

Breaking News: A Texas court halted the execution of Melissa Lucio, who was convicted of killing her 2-year-old child, after new evidence and expert testimony emerged that cast strong doubt on her guilt. https://t.co/yXum4lQVi0
Breaking News: Elon Musk struck a deal on Monday to buy Twitter for roughly $44 billion. https://t.co/HjSHsXcAac

A New York judge held Donald Trump in contempt of court for failing to turn over documents related to an inquiry by the state attorney general. He will be fined $10,000 per day until he cooperates. https://t.co/sjHoGiiSZk https://t.co/vWeRkKpyhR
Breaking News: A state court in Kansas rejected a Republican-drawn map of congressional districts as an unconstitutional gerrymander. https://t.co/I7xi8N5KUT

Donald Trump was held in contempt of court for failing to turn over materials sought by Letitia James, the New York attorney general. He will be fined $10,000 per day until he cooperates. https://t.co/ZhCuWWuR8E
Breaking News: A New York judge held Donald Trump in contempt of court for failing to turn over documents related to an inquiry by the state attorney general. https://t.co/Uyn8HSyMOs

In Opinion
"The irony is that Mr. Putin’s cruel war in Ukraine will achieve the opposite of his ambitions: NATO will emerge from this crisis larger, stronger and more united," writes Anders Fogh Rasmussen, a former NATO secretary general, in a guest essay.https://t.co/euHX7rDgGW

Jon Stewart, the former host of “The Daily Show,” won the Mark Twain Prize for American Humor, one of comedy’s top honors.
The prize ceremony also honored Stewart's activism on behalf of veterans and 9/11 emergency workers. https://t.co/mf5xG3NWmr

In the first days of the war in Ukraine, many people, including Russian President Vladimir Putin, expected the Ukrainian leadership to fracture.
Instead, leading politicians created a largely united front that continues today. https://t.co/CrakRbatJZ
Twitter is nearing a deal to sell itself to Elon Musk, people familiar with the situation said. An agreement could be announced as soon as today. https://t.co/aW3YQEztGv
Breaking News: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said the U.S. wanted Russia to be “weakened” and unable to rebuild its military, a bolder American stance. https://t.co/szF0dl0uwa
Markelle Taylor started running as an antidote to despair in prison. This week he ran the Boston Marathon as a free man — with a time of 2:52:00. https://t.co/8WkW4hkJ77
Twitter is nearing a deal to sell itself to Elon Musk, two people with knowledge of the situation said. https://t.co/sjenMP1Z67

For years, the U.S. sent mixed signals about its interests in Ukraine. Then Russia invaded.
Now, the U.S. is at the center of an extraordinary effort to foil Vladimir Putin, casting the war as a battle between democratic values and authoritarian might. https://t.co/I0wC3nh1Tk

In a trip shrouded in secrecy, Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin made a wartime journey to Ukraine on Sunday, where President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine planned to urge them to provide more aid. https://t.co/vH9ccuopYx

A man who set himself on fire in front of the Supreme Court on Friday in an apparent Earth Day protest against climate change has died. A friend said the self-immolation was "a deeply fearless act of compassion to bring attention to climate crisis." https://t.co/hKSt7eLETi

In some ways, this is the safest time to be an American teenager: drug use, drunk driving and teen pregnancy rates are all down. But a mental health crisis has emerged, with soaring rates of adolescent depression, anxiety and suicide. https://t.co/RZ9MWftZsM https://t.co/7eSGWS5pVy

Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin met with President Volodymyr Zelensky in Kyiv on Sunday, becoming the first senior U.S. officials known to have visited Ukraine since Russia invaded on Feb. 24. https://t.co/meZKd75HvS
You can make pancakes from scratch in about as much time as it takes to make toast 🥞 https://t.co/4EpwxoSl5g https://t.co/E2qUdl33eS
In the shadow of a devastating war, worshipers in Kyiv, Ukraine’s capital, attended services on the holiest day of the year for Orthodox Christians. https://t.co/VOuzZKOnXw https://t.co/IdgcNJ5Jck

Breaking News: Twitter’s board is seriously considering Elon Musk’s $46.5 billion bid to buy the company, people with knowledge of the situation said. The board met on Sunday morning to discuss Musk’s offer, after he began lining up financing last week. https://t.co/knjwxAOzSV
Emmanuel Macron defeated his far-right challenger, Marine Le Pen, becoming the first French president to be re-elected since 2002. https://t.co/AbO3A2cXl6 https://t.co/7IsO3Y7fVN

Speaking to a crowd in front of the Eiffel Tower, a solemn Emmanuel Macron acknowledged "the anger that has been expressed" during a bitter campaign against Marine Le Pen, and that he had a duty to "respond effectively" after his victory. https://t.co/cXEiII4vD1 https://t.co/8yeHHF1pi6
Breaking News: Emmanuel Macron is projected to win a second term as president of France, triumphing on Sunday over Marine Le Pen, his far-right challenger. https://t.co/8iMH4J1fFs

In comments sections, in social media, even in the official pronouncements of the state, Ukrainians are using a new word built from several languages that is not only a condemnation of Russian actions, but also an offering to the Russian language. https://t.co/AyasKPhbfz https://t.co/ibVpWJcojB

American adolescence is undergoing a drastic change. Three decades ago, the gravest public health threats to teens in the U.S. came from drinking, pregnancy and smoking. These have since fallen sharply, while rates of mental health disorders are soaring. https://t.co/TUaqwHLLvH

Mark Meadows, the final chief of staff for President Donald Trump, was told that the events of Jan. 6 could turn violent, but he pushed forward with a rally anyway, the House committee investigating the Capitol attack alleged in a court filing. https://t.co/73tjmgG48p

A Tennessee prosecutor dropped criminal charges against a woman who was sentenced to prison after she tried to restore her right to vote. The case spurred outrage among voting rights supporters, who said it highlighted racial disparities in prosecutions. https://t.co/eVNdLxnnZF
Breaking News: Senator Orrin Hatch, the Utah Republican who crusaded for right-wing causes in a seven-term career, has died. He was 88. https://t.co/L9Ny2kgXRz

Investors and corporations are buying up houses and turning them into rental properties — adding obstacles to first-time home buyers. One estimate says about 2.5 million households shopping for a first home will be shut out of the market this year. https://t.co/9V5uW8D6hG

The dress worn by Judy Garland in "The Wizard of Oz" was given to a priest in 1973, but had been missing for decades when it was found in a shoe box last year. Now a university hopes to auction it off for at least $1.2 million. https://t.co/ZsRzfEspoe

Before the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol, Trump White House officials and members of the right-wing House Freedom Caucus strategized about a plan to direct thousands of angry marchers to the building, according to newly released testimony. https://t.co/WvbRSxZ7CR

About 95 percent of airline pilots in the U.S. today are male, and nearly as many are white. Now, with pilots in short supply, there's urgency for the industry to act on diversifying. https://t.co/FbavdEcsia

After months of begging allies to provide heavy weapons, President Volodymyr Zelensky said Saturday that his pleas were finally being answered: "We will be able to show the occupiers that the day when they will be forced to leave Ukraine is approaching." https://t.co/2Ey8cZS0Su

Breaking News: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said that the U.S. secretary of state, Antony Blinken, and the defense secretary, Lloyd Austin, will visit Kyiv on Sunday. https://t.co/oj1d3oeRU1

Gerhard Schröder has become the most prominent face of a long era of miscalculation that left Germany deeply reliant on Russian gas. He expresses no regret and has also profited handsomely from it, earning millions while promoting Russian energy interests. https://t.co/4gMhiZwkXH https://t.co/Bqhp9Y3lVJ
Mark Meadows, Donald Trump’s former White House chief of staff, was told Jan. 6 could turn violent but pushed ahead with plans for a rally, a House panel said. https://t.co/5nGSKsGBj9

Japan and New Zealand opened talks on an agreement for “seamless” sharing of classified information, a step that could strengthen Tokyo’s case to eventually join the “Five Eyes” intelligence partnership among English-speaking powers. https://t.co/6mc7ORuV4I

The wider ambitions a Russian general expressed on Friday — to take southern Ukraine all the way to Moldova, Ukraine’s southwest neighbor — reveal larger truths about Moscow’s agenda, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said. https://t.co/dMtXcj0pze

Florida rejected dozens of math textbooks last week. Using online sample materials provided by publishers to Florida school districts, The New York Times reviewed 21 of them to figure out why. https://t.co/WtgqF0LDHK
Hackers claim to have broken into dozens of Russian institutions over the past two months, including one of the Kremlin’s intelligence services. https://t.co/rfaFoOIVMr

In a promo for a Tucker Carlson show on Fox News, a naked man atop a rock pile exposes his genitals to red light from what appears to be an air purifier, described as a treatment for a testosterone “calamity.” An endocrinologist says it's all ridiculous. https://t.co/mgy8jcpb58

Rep. Kevin McCarthy’s false claim that he never urged Donald Trump to resign after the Capitol riot exposed the hypocrisy of Republicans who have privately scorned Trump while publicly defending him, a phenomenon widely known but seldom seen in Washington. https://t.co/ECO7XJSYGW

Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene on Friday repeated false claims of fraud in the 2020 election as she defended her actions surrounding the Capitol riot, in an extraordinary hearing on whether she should be labeled an “insurrectionist” and barred from office. https://t.co/WQ2D9fHuUh

The Tennessee General Assembly became what is believed to be the first state legislature to pass a bill that would require drunken drivers to pay child support if they kill the parent of a minor.
The bill will now go to the governor for his signature. https://t.co/75keU4IONb

A series of satellite images show what appears to be a growing mass grave site on the outskirts of Mariupol. The holes were dug between March and April, while Russian forces were in control of the Ukrainian town, according to a New York Times analysis. https://t.co/IYUa6UUf0D https://t.co/znMTSKhozN

The UN detailed a “horror story” of possible war crimes and abuses unfolding in Ukraine, citing indiscriminate shelling, hundreds of summary executions and the widespread devastation of civilian lives. https://t.co/gsZRtcI5Sj

Donald Trump Jr. has agreed to voluntarily meet with the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol attack. Texts show he encouraged White House officials to pursue “multiple paths” to overturn his father’s loss in the days after the election. https://t.co/fmLMrcjhZm

Thirteen female athletes who were sexually assaulted by Larry Nassar are seeking $10 million each from the FBI, alleging that agents mishandled an investigation and allowed the former sports doctor to continue abusing more victims. https://t.co/hOuFTEz64q
